18.post_text: Counting down the roads where to leave #Ferrari’s signature mark. #Vienna

comments.message: Sonu ...let's get down on a ferrari and see the world from a unique view... Bhai ek wo din jarur ayega... Jb hm tm ek two seater luxury me aise hi highway pe honge... 😍😎
Lewis & kimi were clearly faster so seb won by default!!! Cheat
Nikhil R Pawar someone just wiped the smile off Hamilton 😂😂

Ppl complaining about vsc, luck, bad strategy for Kimi, etc but, have you all seen the race? After the SC period, there was no gap between seb and ham. If Mercedes was that superior, they would have put a ton of gap before the vsc deployment. Seb drove masterfully before the front runners stop and then to manage the leadership. If Kimi had the pace, he would have ended 2nd, not 3rd. To me, he failed to exploit an opportunity, not to mention he was pressured all the time by Daniel.

There was a thing that was very interesting, even more than the win though. Looks like Mercedes have issues with their pu. The #PartyMode was just a way to play for audiences, but when came the time to make use of it, they had a number of problems that made ham even give up of the victory with 5 laps to go. That's strange. I never seen a driver with superior equipment and clear perspectives of winning giving up so early. Maybe they can't ride that thing in maximum performance for longer periods.

If that's the case, then it could mean this season isn't over as it appeared.
Yeah congrats! Ferrari is back winning with great tactiks Lucky with virtual safetycar ..good race ..glückwunsch Sebastian en Kimi
Well done, Ferrari! Great race,  you to Daniel great drive.
Kimi was NOT enjoying being sprayed with champagne.

btw, as seb said, we brought the car home, but homework still need to do. as second half of stints, when Lewis did an error and gap sudden built around 2.5s, he can settled about 2 laps with DRS range. effectively, Mercedes were still the biggest threat and how much speed their carrying in 1 lap run, Ferraris still a bit futher back from rivals. good job and well done.

Forza Ferrari
